page.title: 04The Cherhill Gang
page.content:
{ The Cherhill Gang}was a group of footpads who held up travellers in the late{18th Century.}The Cherhill Gang would rob on the{London}to{Bath}road (now called the A4).
One man who was a member of the Cherhill Gang was said to have done his robbing in the nude. He said he did this to avoid recognition! Some of the gang were caught and tried at {Devizes.}They were hung there and later were strung up on a gibbet on {Cherhill Hill}as a warning to anyone who might be tempted to join them.
The headquarters of the gang was the {Black Horse Inn,}one of the four inns in the village at the time. The Black Horse is the only remaining inn and pictures and details of the gang can still be seen there today.
